PageTitle: nexthop recursive-lookup default-route (BGP-IPv6 unicast address family view)
FuncDef:
The nexthop recursive-lookup default-route command enables BGP route recursion to the default route.
The undo nexthop recursive-lookup default-route command restores the default configuration. The nexthop recursive-lookup default-route command enables BGP route recursion to the default route. The undo nexthop recursive-lookup default-route command restores the default configuration. By default, BGP route recursion to the default route is disabled. This command is supported only on the CE6863H, CE6863H-K, CE6860-SAN, CE6866K, CE6866, CE6860-HAM, CE6855-48XS8CQ, CE6885-SAN, CE8850-SAN, CE8855, CE8851-32CQ4BQ, CE8851K, CE8851-32CQ8DQ-P, CE8850-HAM, CE6881H, CE6881H-K, CE6820H, CE6820H-K, CE6820S, CE6885, CE6885-T, CE6885-LL (standard forwarding mode) and CE6863E-48S8CQ.
ExtraInfo: The next hop of a BGP route may not be directly reachable. In this case, route recursion is required. During route recursion, you can run the nexthop recursive-lookup default-route command to enable BGP route recursion to the default IP route in the IPv6 address family view.
